page.title: 12Forests
page.content: The Forestry Commision (based at Wareham) owns land at present their policy for new planting is to interplant conifers, mainly Norway Spruce, with broad leafed trees - usually beech or oak - accordig to local soil conditions. In thirty yeards time, it is estimated that the mature conifers can be felled, thus leaving room for the broad-leafed trees to develop fully. The soil is mostly chalk, with clay in places. On greenhill down in Hilton Parish is a nature Reserve administered by the Dorset Naturalists Trust. This is sometimes grazed by cattle by agreement with Delcombe Farm. it is rich in plants like dog violets and birds fot trefoil which are food for caterpillars and is a notable place for butterflies.
